cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar forms the chrysalis, a protective shell around itself.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developing organism or developmental process generates or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis, metamorphosis forming wings or antennae).

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when it stops eating and prepares for the next stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly wings are formed as new tissues during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developing organism or developmental process generates or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis, metamorphosis forming wings or antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Antennae are among the new structures that form during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developing organism or developmental process generates or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis, metamorphosis forming wings or antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The chrysalis is the structure from which the adult butterfly (adult stage) emerges.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A life-cycle structure or stage transitions into a subsequent life-cycle stage (e.g., chrysalis transitioning to the adult butterfly stage).
remarks: Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.
Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fluid is pumped into the butterfly wings to make them expand and harden.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject fluid fills the internal structure or cavity of the object, typically to enable its expansion or functional development.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A fluid or material occupies the internal volume of an anatomical structure or cavity, typically enabling its expansion, support, or functional development.
args.justification: The current canonical_rel_name 'fills' is overly generic for a global KG predicate and does not indicate that the object is a biological/anatomical structure; 'fills_structure' is more precise and reusable. The relation semantics and existing class/group clearly describe a developmental morphological modification (fluid pumped into wings to expand and harden), so the existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group are retained. Only the predicate and its reusable description are specialized to clarify scope.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: A fluid or material occupies the internal volume of an anatomical structure or cavity, typically enabling its expansion, support, or functional development.
executed_decisions.justification: The current canonical_rel_name 'fills' is overly generic for a global KG predicate and does not indicate that the object is a biological/anatomical structure; 'fills_structure' is more precise and reusable. The relation semantics and existing class/group clearly describe a developmental morphological modification (fluid pumped into wings to expand and harden), so the existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group are retained. Only the predicate and its reusable description are specialized to clarify scope.
